sources.description: April 1863, Civil War: Things are looking bleak for the Union Army. In an effort to harm the Confederate troops, Colonel Marlowe ( John Wayne ) receives orders to destroy a strategically important railroad station behind enemy lines. To Marlowe's chagrin, he has to take the pacifist Dr. Kendall ( William Holden ) with him, with whom he is at odds. During the advance, the troops camp on the plantation of the Southerner Hannah ( Constance Towers ), who sees through the Yankees' plans. To prevent her from jeopardizing the mission, Marlowe takes her prisoner. At "Newton Station," the objective of the mission, a horrific massacre occurs... John Ford 's (1895-1973) only feature-length film about the Civil War is not a typical Western, but a gripping historical adventure based on authentic events.

metadata.Plot: A Union Cavalry outfit is sent behind Confederate lines in strength to destroy a rail/supply center. Along with them is sent a doctor who causes instant antipathy between him and the commander. The secret plan for the mission is overheard by a southern belle who must be taken along to assure her silence. The Union officers each have different reasons for wanting to be on the mission.
metadata.Writer: John Lee Mahin, Martin Rackin, Harold Sinclair
metadata.Actors: John Wayne, William Holden, Constance Towers
